intro: Oxytropis transalaica, commonly known as the Transalpine burr-vetch, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in racemes, followed by pod-like fruits containing several seeds. Oxytropis transalaica is adapted to arid and rocky environments, showcasing its resilience to harsh climatic conditions. Its ecological role includes soil stabilization and providing forage for certain wildlife species.
